items.title: Aryna Sabalenka wins second-straight Brisbane International women's final, beating Marta Kostyuk
items.summary: Aryna Sabalenka has claimed her second-straight Brisbane International title, beating Marta Kostyuk 6-4, 6-3.

items.title: Festival chair, board members quit after author's cancellation from Writers' Week
items.summary: The Adelaide Festival board's decision to cancel the appearance of Palestinian-Australian author Randa Abdel-Fattah from this year's Adelaide Writers' Week has prompted further fallout, with several board members and the chair stepping down.

items.title: Winds push bushfire smoke north, triggering air quality and health warnings for Victoria and NSW
items.summary: Health experts and authorities are urging people living north of Victoria's bushfires to limit their time outdoors as a weather system pushes bushfire smoke across the state and into New South Wales.

items.title: Volunteer firefighter's Alexandra home burns while he battles Victorian bushfires
items.summary: CFA volunteer Michael Harper discovers through the truck radio while on shift that his home is under threat.

items.title: Police discover human remains near car in bushfire-ravaged area east of Seymour
items.summary: Victoria confirms its first fatality in the bushfire emergency ravaging the state, with police discovering human remains east of the town of Seymour.

items.title: Shaun Tan's Tales from Outer Suburbia, now adapted for TV, shows the magic of the everyday
items.summary: Writer Shaun Tan highlighted the magic and whimsy of everyday Australia in his book Tales from Outer Suburbia. He talks about finding inspiration in the mundane, and what it was like turning his tales into TV.

items.title: Planes drop fire retardant ahead of Walwa bushfire
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Aftermath of bushfire in Victoria’s Central Highlands
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Family saves Acheron home after Longwood fire encircles property
items.summary: Everywhere you look around the Irvines' farm near Alexandra are signs of the fire that surrounded their home and burnt right up to the front porch.

items.title: Destruction after bushfire in Harcourt, Victoria
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Puppies of Muster Dogs champion find homes with next generation of farmers
items.summary: In small towns scattered around Australia, five kids have hit the jackpot. They've each been given a puppy from a champion muster dog.

items.title: Macclesfield beats FA Cup champion Crystal Palace 2-1 in major upset
items.summary: Non-league Macclesfield delivers one of the biggest upsets in FA Cup history by stunning defending champion Crystal Palace 2-1.

items.title: Bob Weir, founding member of American rock band the Grateful Dead, dies aged 78
items.summary: Bob Weir's death was announced on Saturday in a statement on his Instagram page.

items.title: Regional healthcare disparities leaving lipoedema patients without adequate care
items.summary: Women with lipoedema in the Northern Territory are struggling to access the care they need, forcing some to relocate for specialist treatment. The condition, often misunderstood, requires better medical support in regional Australia.

items.title: Search for alleged Mullewa gunman Kenneth Giles enters fifth day in WA's Midwest
items.summary: A search and rescue specialist details the significant hurdles faced by police as the manhunt for an alleged gunman in Western Australia's Midwest enters its fifth day.

items.title: Arsenal comes out in support of Kyra Cooney-Cross in wake of mother's cancer diagnosis
items.summary: Arsenal players and supporters pay emotional tributes to Matildas star Kyra Cooney-Cross following her return to Australia to be with her mother, who has been diagnosed with cancer.

items.title: Mystery grips small village of Ross after 'priceless' wool trophy stolen in museum heist
items.summary: For years, a prestigious trophy that represented Australia's ties to Italian high fashion took pride of place in a Tasmanian museum. But it is now missing after a 'targeted' overnight robbery.

items.title: Floodwaters from Queensland bring life to remote NSW wetland
items.summary: In a remote and isolated part of NSW, nature is enjoying a deluge of water still around from floods in Queensland last year.

items.title: Coco Gauff beats Iga Świątek but Poland advances to United Cup final
items.summary: Coco Gauff gets on top of Iga Świątek ahead of the Australian Open, but the US star fails to stop Poland from reaching the United Cup final in Sydney.

items.title: Can spin bowling survive in pace-obsessed Australia?
items.summary: After an Ashes series dominated by pace bowlers, what does the future hold for young spinners wanting to play Test cricket for Australia?

items.title: NSW community bands hit hard as association misses out on vital government funding
items.summary: Wollongong’s collective of brass and wind bands have been putting on a show for locals for almost a century, but it is one of dozens of community bands across the state that faces an uncertain future due to a recent loss of funding.

items.title: Fr Oche singing Lord's Prayer in church
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Catholic priest swaps sermons for rock 'n' roll guitar solos in the Australian outback
items.summary: An Indonesian priest brings a deep love of rock 'n' roll to his pastoral care in western NSW.

items.title: Endangered animal populations bounce back on Kangaroo Island thanks to predator-proof fence
items.summary: Five years after feral cats were removed from inside the Western River Refuge on Kangaroo Island, populations of endangered species have boomed.

items.title: From Madonna to Metallica, these are the big albums turning 40 this year
items.summary: Pop and MTV ruled supreme but 1986 was also a banner year for hip hop and metal.

items.title: Victorian fires: One killed in bushfire disaster in Victoria as hundreds of structures lost — as it happened
items.summary: Several fires have been downgraded to watch and act but authorities are still battling to control many of the blazes that have claimed one life and destroyed hundreds of structures.

items.title: Albanese and Allan unveil $19.5 million support package as crews take stock of Victorian fire devastation
items.summary: Anthony Albanese and Jacinta Allan announce a multi-million-dollar emergency relief package for those affected by Victoria's devastating bushfires, as authorities warn hundreds of structures have been lost.

items.title: Has Trump landed a dud with his Venezuelan oil play?
items.summary: While debate rages over the legality and the potential fallout from America's incursion, there's been a quiet acceptance that it is all about oil.

items.title: Australian Open quiz: Can you get through this round in straight sets?
items.summary: Take the covers off centre court! It's Australian Open time again. How well do you remember grand slams past?

items.title: Eloise Worledge was snatched from her bed. 50 years on her aunt is still looking for answers
items.summary: Fifty years after Beaumaris schoolgirl Eloise Worledge vanished, could new leads solve one of Australia's most haunting cold cases?

items.title: Usman Khawaja stars as Brisbane Heat beat Sydney Thunder in Big Bash
items.summary: Usman Khawaja's international career may be over, but he showed he is far from a spent force by stroking a fine 78 to help the Brisbane Heat to a BBL victory.

items.title: RFS vision of bushfire burning at Brassknocker Firetrail
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Scenes of destruction in Natimuk after Grass Flat fire
items.summary: Follow the latest news headlines from Australia's most trusted source. Read in-depth expert analysis and watch live coverage on ABC News.

items.title: Harcourt residents assessing damage after more than 50 structures lost in Ravenswood fire
items.summary: Harcourt residents describe their devastation and gratitude in the wake of a massive blaze that swept through the town.

items.title: Former Adelaide Festival leaders pressure board to reinstate Palestinian author
items.summary: Nearly a dozen former leaders of the Adelaide Festival are calling for Randa Abdel-Fattah to be reinvited to Writers' Week, adding to a mounting crisis over the Palestinian-Australian author's exclusion from the literary festival.

items.title: Suspected copper thieves cut telecommunications to thousands in cyclone warning zone
items.summary: Thousands of North Queensland residents within a cyclone warning zone were without telecommunications services after suspected copper thieves cut cables.

items.title: Australia will join G7 countries to discuss critical minerals in Washington next week
items.summary: India was also invited to attend the meeting, but it is unclear if it has accepted the invitation.

items.title: Marta Kostyuk crushes Jessica Pegula, Aryna Sabalenka powers past Karolína Muchová to reach Brisbane International final
items.summary: Marta Kostyuk crushed world number six Jessica Pegula in less than an hour after Aryna Sabalenka powered past Karolína Muchová to reach a third consecutive Brisbane International final.

items.title: Donald Trump says oil executives will have 'total safety' if they invest in Venezuela
items.summary: The US president has pivoted to portraying capturing former Venezuelan leader Nicolás Maduro as as a new-found economic opportunity for the US, seizing tankers carrying Venezuelan oil.

items.title: Sixth man charged after livestock carrier allegedly used for cocaine drop in WA waters off Lancelin
items.summary: A sixth man is charged over an alleged plot to import half a tonne of cocaine into Western Australia using an international livestock carrier.

items.title: Hollywood-backed Wrexham knocks Nottingham Forest out of FA Cup
items.summary: As actor and co-owner Ryan Reynolds watched on in the grandstand, Wrexham defeated Nottingham Forest on penalties to advance to the fourth round of the FA Cup.

items.title: Coronial inquest into death of Indigenous woman identifies 'chain of failures' at Royal Darwin Hospital
items.summary: The Northern Territory coroner has determined a series of human errors contributed to the 2022 death of an Indigenous woman at Royal Darwin Hospital, in the weeks after she sought a routine surgery.

items.title: New video emerges of ICE agent shooting Renee Nicole Good in Minneapolis
items.summary: The new footage, reposted by the White House on social media, shows the recording made by the agent responsible for the shooting.

items.title: NT town of Katherine home of Australia's best tasting tap water, nine years after PFAS detected
items.summary: The tap water in the Northern Territory town of Katherine — which includes a "designer" mix of river water from the world-famous Nitmiluk National Park and mineral-rich groundwater — has been named Australia's best drop.

items.title: Christmas Island plastics pollution battle for turtles
items.summary: A beach on a remote island, and home to nesting turtles, is annually overwhelmed by tonnes of plastic garbage. Christmas Island is doing what it can to help stem the never-ending tide of pollution.

items.title: Thousands of alcohol products still without 'mandatory' pregnancy warnings, study finds
items.summary: New research shows thousands of alcohol products remain on Australian shelves without mandated pregnancy warning labels.

items.title: Gladstone company taking centre stage in AI revolution, providing a critical mineral to cool computer chips
items.summary: The industrial hub is playing a key role in the AI industry as it pumps out a critical material needed to cool high-performance computer chips.

items.title: Wildlife ACT calls for more volunteers as demand soars
items.summary: There are about 40-50 active volunteer carers within ACT Wildlife, but the organisation says more are needed, especially as the temperature soars.

items.title: Aryna Sabalenka defeats Madison Keys in Australian Open final re-match at Brisbane International
items.summary: Aryna Sabalenka says she is no longer thinking about last year's Australian Open final loss to Madison Keys after defeating the US star at the Brisbane International.

items.title: Talc Alf's carved artworks attract tourists travelling the Strzelecki Track in outback SA
items.summary: Off the Strzelecki Track in outback South Australia lies the gallery of Talc Alf, so named for the artworks he carves out of soft, powdery talc.

items.title: The King of Rock and Roll transcends language and culture at the Parkes Elvis Festival
items.summary: Japanese tribute artist Toki Toyokazu is part of a growing international presence at the annual Parkes Elvis Festival, which also includes women.

items.title: NSW SES moves to embrace 'volunteers for a day' to boost members after May 2025 floods
items.summary: Experts say volunteering is not in decline, but it is becoming more spontaneous. The NSW disaster agency is moving to embrace this after seven women mobilised 1,200 people to volunteer for a day in record-breaking floods.

items.title: A royal commission into the Bondi terror attack is going ahead. Here's what to know
items.summary: After growing calls for a royal commission into the Bondi terror attack, the prime minister has finally announced it would take place, saying it "was what Australia needs".

items.title: Barmy Army turns Ashes defeat into Australian tourism win
items.summary: The Barmy Army has continued the recent trend of UK travellers spending more time and money in Australia, despite a disappointing on-field performance from their side.

items.title: Cautious hopes Beijing lifting soft ban on South Korean pop culture
items.summary: China has restricted access to South Korean pop culture since 2016, when Seoul received US anti-missile technology. Warmer bilateral ties are spurring optimism that will change.

items.title: Elon Musk's AI bot says it is limiting its ability to 'undress' users. Australians want an opt-out
items.summary: For more than a week, X's AI bot Grok has been generating sexual images of women and children at the request of other users, even when they ask it not to.

items.title: Donald Trump is reshaping American power and the threat to international order is alarming
items.summary: There have been plenty of examples of the Trump administration's contempt for legalities, diplomacy and alliances, but this week Trump and his lieutenants went further.

items.title: Accused scam kingpin Chen Zhi arrives in China after extradition from Cambodia
items.summary: Accused scam boss Chen Zhi is extradited to China from Cambodia after being indicted by the United States over an alleged multi-billion-dollar fraud.

items.title: Police say alleged Mullewa shooter Kenneth Giles was not a licensed firearms owner
items.summary: Police say Kenneth Giles is not a licensed firearms holder, as the search for the 58-year-old continues across hundreds of thousands of kilometres of country WA.

items.title: Family, friends pay tribute to Tasmanian man who died following alleged Hobart CBD altercation
items.summary: A 66-year-old Tasmanian man who died after an alleged altercation in Hobart's CBD on Tuesday night has been remembered by those who knew him.

items.title: Senior SA government officials reject claims of political interference into algal bloom causes
items.summary: Four of the most senior public servants working on South Australia's algal bloom have rejected allegations that departmental staff had been instructed not to investigate the cause of the ecological disaster until after March's state election.

items.title: Surge in heat-related illness as temperatures continue to soar across south-east
items.summary: Emergency departments, medical centres and first responders are dealing with a surge in heat-related illness across Australia's south-east as temperatures soar to near record levels.

items.title: The Bondi royal commission will be a long-term test of Albanese's leadership
items.summary: The prime minister's critics feel he failed to meet the moment in the immediate aftermath of the Bondi attack, but with the royal commission he has a chance to get it right.

items.title: Nick Kyrgios not seeking Australian Open wildcard, saying he is 'not quite ready' for grand slam
items.summary: Returning from injury, Nick Kyrgios has spoken with Australian Open organisers and made the call not to use a wildcard to play singles this year.

items.title: Rio Tinto in merger talks with Glencore, takeover could create world's biggest miner
items.summary: Rio Tinto and Glencore are in takeover talks that could potentially lead to a combined mega-miner worth more than $US200 billion. Analysts are questioning whether Rio will be interested in Glencore's coal assets, having sold off its own in 2018.

items.title: Arsenal's Gabriel Martinelli apologises for 'disgraceful' act towards injured Liverpool player Conor Bradley
items.summary: Arsenal winger Gabriel Martinelli has apologised for shoving Liverpool's Conor Bradley, who was down with a serious knee injury, off the pitch during their Premier League clash.
